welcome.titles: I'm 20 years old, I'm an aspiring front-end developer with a passion for building modern, interactive, and user-friendly web applications. My development journey began with an in-depth study of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, which allowed me to build solid foundations for further work with tools such as React, TypeScript, and Redux.

react.rt: Confident in working with the React library:
react.rt2: I develop and structure components using functional and class approaches. I use hooks (useState, useEffect, useMemo, useReducer and others) to manage the state and life cycle of components. I integrate third-party libraries (React Hook Form, React Slick, React Router and others). I customize interaction components with the server using Axios or Fetch API.

javascript.js: I have a strong knowledge of the basics of the language: ES6+ (arrow functions, destructuring, promises, async/await). I understand and apply the concepts of OOP and functional programming. I work with DOM, events, AJAX requests. I have experience with JavaScript to configure interaction with the API.

typescript.ts: I use TypeScript to type components in React. I work with interfaces, types, generics. I use strong typing to prevent errors at the development stage. I configure projects with TypeScript, including the tsconfig.json configuration.

redux.rd: I work with Redux Toolkit to simplify state management. I create and connect stores, reducers, actions, selectors. I optimize the application through data memoization (reselect). I implement Redux interaction with asynchronous requests through middleware (Redux Thunk, Redux Saga).

git.gt: I am confident in version control tools. I have worked with branches, merging and conflict resolution. I know the basic commands and practices: pull, push, commit, rebase, cherry-pick, stash.

html.htmls: I create adaptive, cross-browser interfaces. I use modern approaches to layout: Flexbox, Grid Layout. I use preprocessors and frameworks (Tailwind CSS, Bootstrap). I optimize interface performance to speed up page loading.

javascript.obou: Learn the basics of JavaScript, including:
javascript.for: Variables, functions, loops and conditions. Working with DOM and events. Asynchronous programming: Promises, async/await.Basics of working with REST API.

react.obou: Mastering React for user interface development:
react.for: Creating components and using JSX. State management using hooks (useState, useEffect). Routing Basics (React Router). Working with external APIs, Axios. Introduction to state management with Redux.
